channel.title: Very wierd
channel.description:
commviews adapter has replaced my computers adapter and is preventing me from playing any game with gameguard.
[img]http://img51.imageshack.us/img51/2289/whaty.png[/img]
a fix?
uninstalling it and reinstalling my driver only reinstalled that driver back... for some reason...
i have uninstalled commview... its been gone for about 4 weeks but still it wont change back...

item.title: Very wierd
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:436627”]Remove the commview driver, normally possible by right clicking it in device manager, or whatever you viewed it. Then let windows try to reinstall the normal driver, if it fails then i’m sure you can find it on the internet somewhere![/quote]?

Read full topic

item.title: Very wierd
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Remove the commview driver, normally possible by right clicking it in device manager, or whatever you viewed it. Then let windows try to reinstall the normal driver, if it fails then i’m sure you can find it on the internet somewhere!

Read full topic

item.title: Very wierd
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“MareInTheMoon, post:4, topic:436627”]Is restoring your computer from its last restore point an option?[/quote]no. i forgot to set that when i got it. lol.

item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:2, topic:436627”]you sure it’s not a virus?[/quote] scanner says nothing, computer runs fine. had commview for 4 years… unistalled it…

the adapter of commview wont go away.
